### Step 1: Understanding Orthographic Perspective
Orthographic perspective is a method of representing three-dimensional objects in two dimensions. It involves parallel projection lines that are perpendicular to the picture plane, resulting in no vanishing points. This type of perspective preserves the true shape and size of objects but can sometimes appear less natural because it doesn't account for how our eyes perceive depth.
